pinyin: ba1 xiao3 shi2 gong1 zuo4 zhi4

definition: credit hour (in an academic credit system)/see also 學分制|学分制[xue2 fen1 zhi4]
being bright at an early age does not necessarily bring success upon growing up (proverb)
pinyin: xiao3 shi2 liao3 liao3 , da4 wei4 bi4 jia1

definition: erhua variant of 小時候|小时候[xiao3 shi2 hou5]

sentences.english: We were kept on tenterhooks for hours while the judges chose the winner.
sentences.chinese: 我們坐立不安了好幾個小時，等着裁判們決定獲勝者。

sentences.english: The water ran for hours before the leak was found.
sentences.chinese: 漏洞發現之前，水已流了數小時。

sentences.english: She ordered gummi bears and a knife a couple hours ago.
sentences.chinese: 幾小時前預定了一些小熊軟糖和一把刀。

sentences.english: The previous record was held by an Indian man who delivered a 120-hour speech.
sentences.chinese: 此前的紀錄爲120小時，由一個印度人創造。

sentences.english: Allow at least three hours between dinner and bedtime.
sentences.chinese: 晚餐和睡覺之間至少允許有三個小時。

sentences.english: I have a job interview in an hour and none of it is coming off.
sentences.chinese: 我一個小時以後要去面試，這些玩意怎麼也洗不掉。

sentences.english: The barber looks around the shop and says, "About 2 hours."
sentences.chinese: 理髮室看了看四周，說，“大約兩個小時。”

sentences.english: Passengers must check in at the airport one hour before plane leaves.
sentences.chinese: 乘客必須在飛機起飛前一小時到機場籤票。

sentences.english: Four hours on the tennis court fagged me out.
sentences.chinese: 在網球場上的四個小時令我精疲力盡語源。

sentences.english: Luckily, it's very straight-forward and takes less than half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，這是非常直接的，並考慮不到一個半小時。

sentences.english: She spent hours admiring herself in the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 她用了幾個小時對着鏡子自我欣賞。

sentences.english: We climbed to the top after an hour.
sentences.chinese: 我們爬了一個多小時纔到達山頂。

sentences.english: The students and the instructor go out driving for blocks of two hours.
sentences.chinese: 指導員與學生出去練兩個小時。

sentences.english: He never climbed trees as a boy because he was afraid that he would fall.
sentences.chinese: 他小時候從未爬過樹，因爲他怕跌下來。

sentences.english: Some stations broadcast 24 hours of the day.
sentences.chinese: 有些電臺一天24小時廣播。

definition: travel time/expected time for a car journey
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
a few years/several years/how many years
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
